result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Jones

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Defendant Kevin L Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Kevin L Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan.  Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea to sole count without repeater- GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 60 days Racine County Jail concurrent to revocation; SERVED. 
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, reduced to judgment.
From deft re: case

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with ANY Walmart Stores

8:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin L Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Kevin L Jones. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motion to modify bond. 
Defense gives further statement as to request as outlined in motion. 
State does not object to signature bond as that is what they asked for at the initial. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Granted, $2000 signature bond with same conditions.
Bail/bond hearing on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense's
